page.title: 08Nature Reserve and Common
page.content: {1Adbaston} The river Sow between Offley Mill and Walk Mill skirts Marsh Meadow a Nature Reserve rented by the Staffs. Nature Conservation Trust; {these plants occur}: Alder, Willow, Tussock Sedge, Bog Bean, Marsh Orchids, Ragged Robin, Moschatel, Yellow Iris, King Cups. {Birds}:Kestrels, Willow and Marsh Tits, Reed Warbler, Tree Creeper, Green Woodpecker, Black Cap and Willow Warbler. {Butterflies}: Brimstone Skipper, Small Tortoise Shell, Green Veined White. {Others}: Dragonflies, Frogs, Toads. Offley Marsh Common pool receives Swans and Mallard Ducks. Coots and Moorhens are resident. {Trees}: Sycamore, Hazel and Willow cover the poorly drained common. The river Sow and its banks is the habitat of Water Rats, Trout, Heron, Water Rail, Willow and Marsh Warblers and Gt. Burr Reed.
